title: RUST_LOG=rustc spews a lot of output when used on source containing `format!`
body:
```
$ RUST_LOG=rustc rustc - <<<'fn main() { format!(""); }'
[...]
stack_check_expr(safe_stack=false, expr=expr(19: __STATIC_FMTSTR))
stack_check_expr(safe_stack=false, expr=expr(21: &[]))
stack_check_expr(safe_stack=false, expr=expr(20: []))
stack_check_expr(safe_stack=false, expr=expr(18: ::std::fmt::Arguments::new))
stack_check_expr(safe_stack=false, expr=expr(30: ::std::fmt::format(&__args)))
callee_ty=extern "Rust" fn(&std::fmt::Arguments<>) -> ~str
stack_check_expr(safe_stack=false, expr=expr(29: &__args))
stack_check_expr(safe_stack=false, expr=expr(28: __args))
stack_check_expr(safe_stack=false, expr=expr(27: ::std::fmt::format))
consume_expr(expr=expr(32: {
    #[address_insignificant]
    static __STATIC_FMTSTR: [::std::fmt::rt::Piece<'static>, ..0u] = [];
    let __args = unsafe { ::std::fmt::Arguments::new(__STATIC_FMTSTR, &[]) };
    ::std::fmt::format(&__args)
}))
>>
<<
use_expr(expr=expr(32: {
    #[address_insignificant]
    static __STATIC_FMTSTR: [::std::fmt::rt::Piece<'static>, ..0u] = [];
    let __args = unsafe { ::std::fmt::Arguments::new(__STATIC_FMTSTR, &[]) };
    ::std::fmt::format(&__args)
}), mode=Move)
comp_mode = Move
consume_block(blk.id=31)
consume_expr(expr=expr(14: []))
>>
>>
scan: 'R' (start)
scan: 'u'
scan: 's'
scan: 't'
scan: ','
scan: '0' (start)
scan: ':'
scan: '1'
scan: '5'
scan: '1'
scan: '9'
scan: '5'
scan: '0'
scan: '|'
scan: 'R' (start)
scan: 'u'
scan: 's'
scan: 't'
scan: ','
scan: 'R' (start)
scan: 'u'
scan: 's'
scan: 't'
scan: ','
scan: '0' (start)
scan: ':'
scan: '1'
scan: '5'
scan: '1'
scan: '9'
scan: '6'
scan: '4'
scan: '|'
>>
<<
>>
<<
>>
Looking up syntax::ast::DefId{crate: 1, node: 151964}
looking up syntax::ast::DefId{crate: 1, node: 151965} : ****SEVERAL SECOND PAUSE*** extra::ebml::Doc{data: @~[168u8, 16u8, 0u8, 0u8, 16u8, 54u8, 9
9u8, 54u8, 53u8, 99u8, 102u8, 52u8, 98u8, 52u8, 52u8, 51u8, 51u8, 52u8, 49u8, 98u8, 49u8, 161u8, 16u8, 0u8, 8u8, 202u8
, 162u8, 16u8, 0u8, 5u8, 248u8, 152u8, 16u8, 0u8, 5u8, 243u8, 153u8, 16u8, 0u8, 0u8, 3u8, 100u8, 111u8, 99u8, 160u8, 1
6u8, 0u8, 5u8, 230u8, 47u8, 42u8, 33u8, 10u8, 10u8, 35u8, 32u8, 84u8, 104u8, 101u8, 32u8, 82u8, 117u8, 115u8, 116u8, 3
2u8, 115u8, 116u8, 97u8, 110u8, 100u8, 97u8, 114u8, 100u8, 32u8, 108u8, 105u8, 98u8, 114u8, 97u8, 114u8, 121u8, 10u8
[...continues for a long time...]
```

Note the pause after the second `lookup syntax::ast::DefId` (possibly it formatting the string with the vector (crate metadata?) for printing).

For comparison,

```
$ RUST_LOG=rustc rustc - <<<'fn main() { let a = ~1; }'
```

runs fine.
